cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ethical guidelines are part of the means by which the potential of AI is harnessed for the benefit of all.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: Within the context of AI development and deployment
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: BenefitScope: for the benefit of all

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Regulations are also part of the mechanism to harness the potential of AI for the benefit of all.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: BenefitScope: for the benefit of all

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Promoting accountability is presented as a way to work towards harnessing the potential of AI.

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: Within governance and oversight of AI technologies

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a mechanism, guideline, or practice) is used as a means to work towards achieving the object outcome or potential.
args.justification: In all three relations, the subject (ethical guidelines, regulations, accountability) functions as a means or mechanism to work towards a shared goal (the potential of AI benefiting all). This is a stable, domain-agnostic purpose/means-to-goal pattern, best captured as 'used_to_achieve'.
args.remark: Object here is the potential/benefits of AI, but the predicate is defined in a domain-agnostic way so it can be reused for other goal-oriented governance mechanisms.

args.justification: Each relation links a governance mechanism or normative concept to a desired outcome (harnessing AI's potential for the benefit of all). This is a classic purpose/goal-directed relation family rather than composition, hierarchy, or simple association.

The semantics emphasize using governance tools (guidelines, regulations, accountability) as instruments to achieve a goal, fitting a broad usage/means-to-an-end category rather than pure causality or identity.
